intro: Eleocharis bermudiana, commonly known as Bermuda grass sedge, is a flowering plant native to Bermuda and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, triangular spikes of flowers. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often found in coastal areas. Its ecological importance includes stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
